prerequisite.div: Freshman standing; a major in the College of Business Administration. Pass/No Pass only.

description.div: Focuses on self-assessment and the transition to the College of Business Administration. Part of the Professional Enhancement Program (PrEP), a series of classes designed to develop professional, confident and polished students for lifelong career success.

prerequisite.div: Pass/No Pass only.Â Open to CBA students only, with limited sections available to other University students.

description.div: A basic-skills computer course designed to ensure that students will be able to demonstrate a minimum degree of computer proficiency using basic business software packages that are required to earn a degree from the College of Business Administration (CBA) or for a non-CBA major enrolled in a CBA course.

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program; admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management.

notes.div: First course in the Raikes School core.

description.div: Introduction to financial accounting, accounting systems, basic finance, management and information systems. Content integration and application, problem-solving and situational analysis.

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program; admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD/RAIK 181H.

notes.div: Second course in the Raikes School core.

description.div: Introduction to managerial accounting and microeconomics. Continuation of management, information systems and accounting systems topics. Content integration and application, problem-solving and situational analysis.

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program; Admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management.

notes.div: First course in the Raikes School leadership core. BSAD/RAIK 185H is 'Letter grade only'.

description.div: Introduction to personal development and its application to leadership.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD/RAIK 185H.

notes.div: Second course in the Raikes School leadership core. BSAD/RAIK is 'Letter grade only'.

description.div: Continued pursuit and analysis of personal development and its application to leadership. Introduction to teams.

prerequisite.div: Permission of Department Chair.

div.em: Amount of credit to be earned is determined by the instructor at the time of registration.

description.div: Topics vary.

notes.div: Open only to CBA Honors Academy students or by permission

description.div: Variety of topics at the undergraduate level.

prerequisite.div: Sophomore standing; ENGL150 or ENGL151.

description.div: Principles of effective written business communication. Focus on effective writing strategies used in business disciplines.

prerequisite.div: Majors in College of Business Administration; Sophomore Standing; 2.5 GPA.

notes.div: Offered Pass/No Pass.

description.div: Focuses on career development and planning.Â Part of the Professional Enhancement Program (PrEP), a series of classes designed to develop professional, confident and polished students for lifelong career success.

prerequisite.div: Open only to students in the CBA Honors Academy or by permission. Â Major in College of Business Administration, Sophomore standing, 2.5 GPA.

notes.div: Offered Pass/No Pass.

description.div: Focuses on career development and planning.Â Part of the Professional Enhancement Program (PrEP), a series of classes designed to develop professional, confident and polished students for lifelong career success.

course.title: Honors: Business Systems and Operations I

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program; admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD/RAIK 182H.

notes.div: Third course in the Raikes School core.

description.div: Focus on operations management. Introduction to advanced management principles and accounting system development. Content integration and application, problem-solving and situational analysis.

course.title: Honors: Business Systems and Operations II

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program; admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD/RAIK 281H.

notes.div: Fourth course in the Raikes School core.

description.div: Continuation of operations management topics including advanced management principles and accounting system development. Content integration and application, problem-solving and situational analysis.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD/RAIK 186H.

notes.div: Third course in the Raikes School leadership core. BSAD/RAIK 285H is 'Letter grade only'.

description.div: Making sense of yourself and others. Applications to team communication and shared leadership development.

prerequisite.div: Admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD 285H/RAIK 285H.

notes.div: Final course in the Raikes School leadership core. BSAD 286H/RAIK 286H is 'Letter grade only'.

description.div: Continued making sense of yourself and others. Further applications to team and shared leadership communication and development.

prerequisite.div:
Good standing in the University Honors Program or by invitation; admission to the Jeffrey S. Raikes
School of Computer Science and Management; BSAD/RAIK 282H; and CSCE/RAIK 284H.

notes.div: First semester of Jeffrey S. Raikes School of Computer Science and Management design studio sequence.

description.div: Application of Jeffrey S. Raikes School of Computer Science and Management core content in a team oriented, project management setting. Complete projects in consultation with private and public sector clients.

prerequisite.div:
Good standing in the University Honors Program or by invitation; admission to the Jeffrey S. Raikes
School of Computer Science and Management; and BSAD/CSCE/RAIK 301H.

notes.div: Second semester in the Jeffrey S. Raikes School of Computer Science and Management design studio sequence.

description.div: Application of Raikes School core content in a team oriented, project management setting. Complete projects in consultation with private and public sector clients.

prerequisite.div: Sophomore standing or by permission.

description.div: Explores complex global issues from an interdisciplinary perspective. Â Examines how change and innovation are continuously transforming human endeavors such as technology, business, politics, laws, culture and arts.Â Investigates how innovation and change can provide new solutions to the many challenges humanity faces, yet may create novel problems and unintended consequences.

prerequisite.div: Majors in College of Business Administration; 2.5 GPA; BSAD 222.

notes.div: Offered Pass/No Pass.

description.div: Focuses on internship/job search strategies. Part of the Professional Enhancement Program (PrEP), a series of classes designed to develop professional, confident and polished students for lifelong career success.

course.title: Ethics for Business Leaders/the Job Search Process

prerequisite.div: Open only to CBA Honors Academy students in good standing or by permission. Â Major in College of Business Administration, Junior standing, 2.5 GPA;Â BSAD222 or BSAD222H.

notes.div: Offered Pass/No Pass. Â This course will meet for 75 minutes twice a week for 5 weeks.

description.div: Focuses on business ethics terminology and concepts, ethical decision making approaches, accountability of corporations and leaders, impact of ethical considerations in a global environment. Â Also focuses on navigating internships and the job search process.

course.title: Honors: Advanced Topics in Business I

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program and admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management; BSAD/RAIK 282H.

notes.div: Fifth course in the Raikes School core.

description.div: Macroeconomics and introduction to advanced topics in accounting systems, finance, management and information systems. Content integration and application to problem-solving and situational analysis.

course.title: Honors: Advanced Topics in Business II

prerequisite.div: Good standing in the University Honors Program; admission to the Raikes School of Computer Science and Management and BSAD/RAIK 381H.

notes.div: Sixth course in the Raikes School core.

description.div: Microeconomics. Continuation of advanced topics in accounting systems, finance, management and information systems. Content integration and application, problem-solving and situational analysis.

prerequisite.div: Permission of Department Chair.

course.title: Global Leadership and the Culture Map

prerequisite.div: Sophomore standing or by permission

description.div: Connects business functional areas to global contexts in theory and practice. Â Covers international management from a strategic perspective with an in-depth focus on cross-cultural dimensions among countries. Examines emerging competitive strategies used by multinational companies and strategic issues in international company expansions and international venture launches.

prerequisite.div: Majors in College of Business Administration; 2.5 GPA; Senior standing or by permission.

notes.div: Offered Pass/No Pass only.

description.div: Focuses on professional and life skills. Part of the Professional Enhancement Program (PrEP), a series of classes designed to develop professional, confident and polished students for lifelong career success.

prerequisite.div: Open only to CBA Honors Academy students in good standing or by permission. Â Major in College of Business Administration, 2.5 GPA; BSAD333 or BSAD333H.

notes.div: Offered Pass/No Pass Only.

description.div: Focuses on professional and life skills. Part of the Professional Enhancement Program (PrEP), a series of classes designed to develop professional, confident and polished students for lifelong career success.

course.title: International Studies in Business and Economics

prerequisite.div: Permission of Program Coordinator, major or interest in business administration or by invitation.

notes.div: Passport to travel in some countries required, educational visa may be required. Student must confer with the College of Business Administration (CBA) faculty adviser to determine if course work is applicable towards a specific CBA major. Travel outside the United States is required. Arrangements for payment and program costs (tuition, transportation, room and/or board, etc.) will vary depending on the program.

description.div: Primary study at site(s) outside the United States with topics to vary depending on the country(ies) and area of study.

notes.div: BSAD 92 requires writing resumes and letters of application and going through a mock interview. Pass/No Pass only.

description.div: Seminar to develop job-hunting skills as applied to the fields of business. How to go about the job-hunting process efficiently and effectively. Experiential in design. Assess capabilities and research potential employers.

prerequisite.div: First year College of Business Administration student or permission.

notes.div: P/N only.

description.div: Overview of academic requirements, majors, resources and activities. Self-assessment activities, University and College policies, procedures and co-curricular options. Introduction to the majors and internships, career and study abroad opportunities.

prerequisite.div: Pass/No Pass only; Open to CBAÂ students only; Must be taken in the final semester in the College; 2.5 cumulative GPA required

description.div: Utilizing Blackboard, graduating seniors are informed of appropriate career-related announcements, activities, and responsibilities. Assessment activities are conducted through class and include such exams as the Educational Testing Service Major Field Exam, the College of Business Administration Student Survey, the Employment (post-graduation plans) Survey, and other assessment related activities.
